text: We hosted the 9th Annual Veterans & First Responders Resource Fair & Recreation Day in Flushing. It was a wonderful day connecting veterans, first responders, and their families from Genesee County with the resources available to them. https://t.co/NBFa0CG98Y
As the sun sets and Rosh Hashanah begins, wishing a sweet, safe, healthy, and happy New Year to our Jewish friends in mid-Michigan and around the world. L'Shana Tova! https://t.co/SPvF0X9x4Q

8 months into my first term, I can tell you that “The Swamp” is real. Until we clean it up, places like mid-Michigan will continue to pay the price. 

Here are four commonsense ways to fix it:  https://t.co/wfAWqfS0FB
I voted yes on today’s resolution condemning the murder of Charlie Kirk, because in this moment of escalating tension, it is critical to stand firmly and unambiguously against political violence.

Murder is wrong. Political violence is wrong. 

I had many strong disagreements with Charlie Kirk. That does not change the fact that his murder was an unacceptable tragedy.
At the beginning of this week, I laid out what it will take to get my vote – steps to actually lower costs for people in mid-Michigan. This is not it.

The budget we voted on today continues the same policies that are failing working families in my district: historic tax breaks to billionaires and big corporations while taking health care and food away from everyone else.

Across the country, people are struggling. Eight months of price increases, tariff taxes on working families, and trillion-dollar health care cuts have made things worse. We need change, not more of the same.

The clock is ticking. If we fail to act before the end of the year, Michigan families are going to see their health care premiums skyrocket.

I led 36 of my colleagues today in calling on Congress to renew the ACA tax credits and lower health care costs. https://t.co/5vzWxYARan

After passing historic tax cuts for billionaires, GOP leaders are unwilling to vote on the tariff taxes raising costs for working families. 

These priorities are backwards. 
https://t.co/8BC7S2qRwE

September 11, 2001 remains one of the darkest days in our nation’s history.

Today, we remember the thousands of innocent souls lost and honor the heroic first responders who ran into an unfathomable tragedy.

The shooting of Charlie Kirk is immoral, un-American, and disgusting. We should all pray for him and his family.

The escalating political violence in this country must be a call to action for both Democrats and Republicans. It needs to stop.

Great Lakes Bay Health Centers provides quality, affordable care to thousands of our neighbors every year.

I stopped by one of their Saginaw facilities to talk to staff & patients about their experiences & how we can make sure everyone in mid-Michigan has access to health care. https://t.co/0FgeEdAXAY

National Night Out celebrations in Grand Blanc & Saginaw Townships were fun opportunities for neighbors to better get to know the men and women who put their lives on the line every day to keep us safe. https://t.co/UP3iZ1eqsi

Taking your family to Disney World was a point of pride & joy for millions of American families. It was for mine. But like so many parts of the American Dream, it’s slipping away. 

Our economy needs to work for all Americans, not just the ultra-wealthy. 
https://t.co/CykZrDqX69
Happy gameday, Michigan! GO LIONS! 💙🤍🏈

Five years after the 2020 floods, communities in Midland County are still waiting on FEMA reimbursements.

The Rapid Disaster Relief Act will cut red tape & fast-track disaster relief to communities so they can get started with recovering & rebuilding. https://t.co/ncwHJIUOSu

Enough is enough. Earlier this week, I signed onto the bipartisan discharge petition to force a vote on releasing the Epstein files. 

Victims deserve justice, Americans deserve the truth, and nobody is above the law.

Labor Day is more than a celebration — it’s a call to action.

From Teamsters fighting for fair wages & working conditions in Grand Blanc to rallying for families over billionaires in Bay City & Midland, mid-Michigan is standing up for working people. https://t.co/DXSoBtlZcP
There's more work to do, but for now I hope everyone enjoys a well-earned day of rest. 🇺🇸💪🌭

Happy #LaborDay! The labor movement built the middle class, and it started here in Michigan.

Last year, Michigan repealed Right to Work, restored the prevailing wage, & passed the working family tax credit. https://t.co/nYG5hdAxZo

Making it harder for seniors to access Medicare is unacceptable. I'm against this pilot program and will fight against it being taken nationwide.
https://t.co/qlDKiGwWOP

I don't pretend to have all the answers, but we can't do nothing and hope things get better. Commonsense gun violence prevention must be at the top of Congress' agenda when we return.
We've seen similar eruptions of gun violence in mid-Michigan all summer. We are failing our children in one of our most important jobs: keeping them safe.

We need to focus every tool we have towards preventing this kind of needless violence from continuing to tear our community apart.
Those responsible need to be fully held accountable. All summer, mid-Michigan has suffered from unacceptable gun violence, including a one-year-old boy being shot and killed in Saginaw last week.

Sunday night, what was supposed to be a unifying community celebration in Flint erupted into reckless violence. I offer my condolences to the family of the young woman who lost her life, and we continue to pray for the full recovery of the boy who was shot.

For 60 years, Medicare & Medicaid have made quality, affordable health care a reality for millions of Americans. 

While out-of-touch extremists put tax cuts for the rich ahead of healthcare for you, I’m fighting every day to strengthen these life-saving programs.

The consequences of cutting health care to pay for handouts to millionaires are real. 

Allison is from Flint, and her daughter relies on Medicaid for cancer treatments. Blanket cuts to the program do nothing to make their lives easier. https://t.co/JaBr4Bk1Xi
